title: Application of Regulating Intestinal Flora in the Treatment of Severe Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia (COVID-19)
brief_title: Application of Regulating Intestinal Flora in the Treatment of Severe Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia (COVID-19)
abstract: To evaluate the effect of intestinal flora treatment on the efficacy, safety and prognosis of patients with NCP; to find effective treatment options for NCP.
interventions: {"(\"Experimental group\",,\"Regulating intestinal flora + conventional treatment\",,)","(\"Control group\",,\"conventional treatment\",,)"}
study_eligibility_criteria: Participants with 18 to 75 years of age who have been diagnosed with NCP by nucleic acid testing and meet the clinical classification of severe NCP referring to the clinical classification standard in the General Office of the National Health and Health Commission-Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia Diagnosis and Treatment Program (Trial Version 4).
investigators: {"(Huaqi,Wang,ur.0737632001.38,Applicant,\"{\"\"(\\\\\"\"The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University\\\\\"\",{grid.412633.1},{1784658},{CN},{})\"\"}\")","(Huaqi,Wang,ur.0737632001.38,\"Study leader\",\"{\"\"(\\\\\"\"The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University\\\\\"\",{grid.412633.1},{1784658},{CN},{})\"\"}\")"}

title: A Phase 3 Randomized Study to Evaluate the Safety and Antiviral Activity of Remdesivir GS-5734 in Participants with Moderate  COVID-19 Compared to Standard of Care Treatment
brief_title: This study will test a drug named remdesivir GS-5734 to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of the drug in treating patients with moderate coronavirus disease 2019 COVID-19 compared to standard of care treatment.

title: CO-PARENT: COVID-19 - Parent Action in Response to Emotions and Needs for Treatment
brief_title: CO-PARENT: COVID-19 - Parent Action in Response to Emotions and Needs for Treatment
abstract: The purpose of this research study is to collect information to better understand caregiver responses to COVID-19 stress and to help caregivers cope with these stressors.
interventions: {"(\"Delayed Condition, Immediate Condition\",\"UP-COVID is a group therapy session with each session lasting approximately 60-90 minutes. The sessions will focus on cognitive and behavioral strategies for managing their own distress, anxiety and sadness related to COVID-19, as well as, strategies related to parenting in the midst of the crisis.\",Behavioral,\"Unified Protocol for COVID-19 Parenting Stress (UP-COVID)\",)","(\"Delayed Condition\",\"Brochure that details techniques for coping with stress.\",Behavioral,SHG,)"}
study_arms: {"(Experimental,\"Immediate Condition\",\"Participants in the Immediate Condition group will receive a total of 4 sessions of Unified Protocol for COVID-19 Parenting Stress (UP-COVID) intervention\")","(\"Active Comparator\",\"Delayed Condition\",\"Participants in the Delayed Condition group will receive the Self Help Guide (SHG) by the National Child Traumatic Stress Network (NCTSN). They will then receive the UP-COVID intervention following their week 6 assessment\")"}
study_outcome_measures: {"(primary,\"Measure of Anxiety as assessed by the OASIS\",\"week 6 and week 12\")","(primary,\"Measure of Depression as assessed by the ODSIS\",\"week 6 and week 12\")","(primary,\"Measure of PTSD as assessed by the PCL-5\",\"week 6 and week 12\")","(secondary,\"Measure of Parenting Overprotection/Overcontrol as assessed by the S-EMBU\",\"week 6 and week 12\")","(secondary,\"Measure of Parenting Rejection as assessed by the S-EMBU\",\"week 6 and week 12\")","(secondary,\"Measure of Parenting Emotional Warmth as assessed by the S-EMBU\",\"week 6 and week 12\")","(secondary,\"Measure of Parent Accommodation for Child Anxiety as assessed by the FASA\",\"week 6 and week 12\")"}
study_eligibility_criteria: Inclusion Criteria: consent to participate via RedCap indicate a mild or greater elevation on screening measures of anxiety, depression and/or traumatic stress have a child between 6 and 13 years speak/read English or Spanish fluently Exclusion Criteria: reported severe mental illness (e.g., bipolar disorder, schizophrenia, an intellectual disability, psychosis, alcohol use disorder, substance use disorder) or hospitalization for mental health concerns or suicide attempt. reported prior arrest for child endangerment, child abuse or child neglect, or prior investigation by the Florida Department of Children and Families (DCF) may be excluded if the severity of current mental illness is such that outpatient, weekly group treatment would be considered inappropriate
mesh_terms: {Infections,"Pneumonia, Viral",COVID-19,"Stress Disorders, Traumatic","Lung Diseases","Virus Diseases","RNA Virus Infections",Pneumonia,"Respiratory Tract Diseases","Mental Disorders","Trauma and Stressor Related Disorders","Respiratory Tract Infections","Coronaviridae Infections","Coronavirus Infections","Nidovirales Infections"}
organisation_details: {"(\"University of Miami\",grid.26790.3a,Sponsor,{US},{US-FL},{4151871})","(\"University of Miami\",grid.26790.3a,Location,{US},{US-FL},{4151871})","(\"Jill May Ehrenreich - University of Miami\",grid.26790.3a,Affiliated,{US},{US-FL},{4151871})","(\"University of Miami\",grid.26790.3a,Affiliated,{US},{US-FL},{4151871})"}
category_uoa: ({A03},"{""(30003,A03,\\""Allied Health Professions, Dentistry, Nursing and Pharmacy\\"")""}")

title: Laparoscopy and COVID-19 Contamination
abstract: The aim of the study is to search the presence of the SARS-COV-2 virus (COVID19) in the pneumoperitoneum of patients with a positive (or suspected) COVID19 status during a routine laparoscopy.
interventions:
{"(,\"Swab of the peritoneal fluid for traces of COVID19. The collection of peritoneal fluid is a standard care practice.
Swab from the laparoscopy filter\",Other,\"Additional and minimal collection of products of the human body carried out during a sample for standard of care\",)"}
study_outcome_measures: {"(primary,\"The main objective of the study is to demonstrate the presence of SARS-COV-2 in the exsufflated gas at the end of laparoscopy.\",\"Day 1 , at the end of the surgery\")","(secondary,\"The secondary objective of the study is to demonstrate the presence of SARS-COV-2 in the peritoneal fluid during laparoscopy\",\"Day 1 , at the end of the surgery\")"}
study_eligibility_criteria: Inclusion Criteria: Patient of legal age Indication for laparoscopy Positive (past or current) or suspected Covid19 status (cough, fever, suggestive radiological images, etc.) Lack of opposition to participating in the study Exclusion Criteria: Patient under legal protection Covid19 status negative, (former or current) and not suspected Patient unable to object Patient with no social security care
mesh_terms: {"Lung Diseases","Respiratory Tract Infections","Pneumonia, Viral","Nidovirales Infections","Respiratory Tract Diseases","RNA Virus Infections","Coronavirus Infections",COVID-19,"Virus Diseases","Coronaviridae Infections",Pneumonia,Infections}
